title: "Feels awful to play as" Champs
body:
Sion: He felt fun after his rework, but after he was nerfed repeatedly, Sion feels insanely clunky because he counterplays himself. It's an irritating struggle to play him because how unreliable and telegraphed his kit is. 

Cass: I miss her pre-rework kit.

Aatrox: He's an example of a contradiction. It's not like I hate him, I love Aatrox, but I feel useless because my kit doesn't flow. 

Darius: Decimate is so god damn annoying to use. It's puny range and cast-time is simply frustrating

Atleast when he manages to hit from the shaft, it dealt a good amount of damage. With this Darius, if you mess up, you automatically lose the trade or even worse, lose the team fight.

At first I hated the reworked Q, the delay felt clunky and the heal was (and still is) out of place. But I learned to like it, correct use is a more visible expression of skill than before (as it used to be "press Q for +1 blood stack") and if you learn to consistently hit the sweet spot in trades, ganks, and teamfights, you benefit tremendously. Most importantly, it increased counterplay, which is what allowed him to get away with his incredibly strong new passive, and Dunking is what's really fun about Darius, not so much the obnoxious lane bully part (we already have Renekton for that)

Poppy's Q and ult both hit them with her hammer. E and Q do synergize well, as an E into the wall guarantees you hit both parts of your Q if you use it immediately after. And her ult is just one you need to get a feel for. More often than not, you're either going to insta-cast for chain CC and/or the damage, or give it a quick charge to knock away a sudden and immediate threat. If you're trying to use it for anything else,  there's always the chance that you'll do something like knock away a low HP enemy that your team was about to kill. But as long as you don't try to use a charged ult as a finisher, you should be fine.
